intro: Psychotria diplococca var. diplococca, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround small white flowers, making it visually distinctive. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological studies.
